column1: Progreso is a city in the Canelones Department of southern Uruguay.
Progreso is also the name of the municipality to which the city belongs.
The city is located on the old Route 5 (which runs parallel to the railway track Montevideo - Santa Lucia)
column2: about 29 kilometres (18 mi) from the centre of Montevideo. It belongs to the wider metropolitan area of Montevideo.

column1: The city was founded on 15 November 1871 under the name of Progreso
column4: the place where the current city is located received the name of Puntas del Canelón Chico or Arroyo del Gigante.The name Progreso is due to the arrival of the railway in 1871
column5: which was introduced into Uruguay by the English.The railway system enabled the place to expand itself beyond its original borders and to achieve
column7: some sort of economic prosperity. The railway system also resulted in the establishment of some English families near the industrial area of the city. Today the wooded avenue that leads to the railway station is known as the Avenida de los Ingleses
column8: meaning «Avenue of the Englishmen». The neighborhood where this station is located is known as the Villa Inglesa
column9: «English Village».Its status was elevated to "Pueblo" (village) category on 1 July 1953 by the Act of Ley Nº 11.968
column10: and then on 11 December 1981 to "Ciudad" (city) by the Act of Ley Nº 15.228.Present-day Progreso
column12: ranks high in Uruguay as far as the unemployment rate is concerned.

column4: the Intendencia de Canelones had estimated a population of 19
column5: 578 for the municipality during the elections.
